title: H01-1042

sentences.text: The purpose of this research is to test the efficacy of applying automated evaluation techniques , originally devised for the evaluation of human language learners , to the output of machine translation -LRB- MT -RRB- systems .
We believe that these evaluation techniques will provide information about both the human language learning process , the translation process and the development of machine translation systems .
This , the first experiment in a series of experiments , looks at the intelligibility of MT output .
A language learning experiment showed that assessors can differentiate native from non-native language essays in less than 100 words .
Even more illuminating was the factors on which the assessors made their decisions .
We tested this to see if similar criteria could be elicited from duplicating the experiment using machine translation output .
Subjects were given a set of up to six extracts of translated newswire text .
Some of the extracts were expert human translations , others were machine translation outputs .
The subjects were given three minutes per extract to determine whether they believed the sample output to be an expert human translation or a machine translation .
Additionally , they were asked to mark the word at which they made this decision .
The results of this experiment , along with a preliminary analysis of the factors involved in the decision making process will be presented here .

summary: The purpose of this research is to test the efficacy of applying automated evaluation techniques , originally devised for the evaluation of human language learners , to the output of machine translation -LRB- MT -RRB- systems . We believe that these evaluation techniques will provide information about both the human language learning process , the translation process and the development of machine translation systems . This , the first experiment in a series of experiments , looks at the intelligibility of MT output . A language learning experiment showed that assessors can differentiate native from non-native language essays in less than 100 words . Even more illuminating was the factors on which the assessors made their decisions . We tested this to see if similar criteria could be elicited from duplicating the experiment using machine translation output . Subjects were given a set of up to six extracts of translated newswire text . Some of the extracts were expert human translations , others were machine translation outputs . The subjects were given three minutes per extract to determine whether they believed the sample output to be an expert human translation or a machine translation . Additionally , they were asked to mark the word at which they made this decision . The results of this experiment , along with a preliminary analysis of the factors involved in the decision making process will be presented here .

Predicate-is_to_test_the_efficacy_of_app.label: is to test the efficacy of applying
Predicate-is_to_test_the_efficacy_of_app.description: This predicate indicates a purpose or intention for testing the effectiveness of using a particular method (object) in relation to a specific context or domain (subject). It implies that the subject is considering applying the object as a means to achieve some goal, and wants to evaluate its suitability for this purpose.

Predicate-originally_devised_for.label: originally devised for
Predicate-originally_devised_for.description: The predicate 'originally devised for' indicates a historical or original purpose of something (the subject), which was intended to serve or benefit another entity, concept, or group (the object). It highlights that the subject's primary intention or design was directed towards achieving some goal or outcome related to the object.

Predicate-provide_information_about.label: provide information about
Predicate-provide_information_about.description: To 'provide information about' means to offer or convey knowledge, details, or insights regarding a specific topic, entity, or concept. The subject of this predicate (e.g., applying automated evaluation techniques) is the source that generates and shares this information, which is then focused on providing insight into the object (e.g., the human language learning process). This predicate establishes a connection between the subject's output and the object being described, highlighting the significance or relevance of the provided information.

Predicate-showed_that.label: showed that
Predicate-showed_that.description: The predicate 'showed that' indicates a demonstration or presentation of evidence or proof that supports a particular claim, conclusion, or finding. It connects the subject (the entity performing the action) to the object (the presented evidence or proof), suggesting that the subject has provided sufficient grounds for believing in the truthfulness of the stated fact.

Predicate-are_based_on.label: are based on
Predicate-are_based_on.description: The predicate 'are based on' indicates a relationship where the subject's existence or validity relies on or originates from the object. In general, it suggests that the subject's characteristics, properties, or decisions are derived from or grounded in the information provided by the object.

Predicate-were_given.label: were given
Predicate-were_given.description: The predicate 'were given' indicates that the subject has received or been provided with something. It implies a transfer of possession, information, or authority from one entity to another.

Predicate-were.label: were
Predicate-were.description: Indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject has been characterized or classified as having the property described by the object. This predicate suggests that there exists some correspondence, similarity, or equivalence between the two entities.

Predicate-mark.label: mark
Predicate-mark.description: To indicate or identify something as having a particular characteristic, feature, or significance. The predicate 'mark' connects the subject to an object that has been designated, labeled, or distinguished in some way.

Predicate-were_elicited_from_duplicating.label: were elicited from duplicating the experiment using machine translation output
Predicate-were_elicited_from_duplicating.description: This predicate indicates that a set of information or data was obtained by replicating an experiment and processing its results through machine translation. The connection between the subject and object is one of origin, suggesting that the subject (factors on which assessors made their decisions) has its roots in the process described in the predicate.

Predicate-showed.label: showed
Predicate-showed.description: The predicate 'showed' indicates a demonstration or presentation of evidence, results, or facts by its subject. It implies that the subject has revealed or disclosed something about itself or another entity to others.

Predicate-tested.label: tested
Predicate-tested.description: The predicate 'tested' indicates the act of examining or evaluating something to determine its quality, accuracy, or effectiveness. It implies a process of investigation, analysis, and possibly experimentation to gather evidence or data about the object being tested.

Predicate-was_conducted_in_order_to.label: was conducted in order to
Predicate-was_conducted_in_order_to.description: This predicate indicates a purpose or intention behind an action. It connects the subject (the entity that performed the action) to the object (the outcome, goal, or objective of the action), implying that the action was taken with a specific aim in mind.

Predicate-conducted.label: conducted
Predicate-conducted.description: To conduct something means to take charge of its execution, management, or supervision. It implies being in control and overseeing the process from start to finish, ensuring that it unfolds as intended.

Predicate-looks_at.label: looks at
Predicate-looks_at.description: The predicate 'looks at' indicates a relationship where the subject (experiment) focuses its attention or consideration on the object (the purpose of this research), often implying an examination, scrutiny, or analysis.

Predicate-was_tested_to_see_if_similar_c.label: was tested to see if similar criteria could be elicited
Predicate-was_tested_to_see_if_similar_c.description: This predicate indicates that a subject was subjected to an evaluation or examination with the goal of determining whether certain criteria can be applied similarly. The object represents the context in which this testing took place, and the connection between the subject and object suggests a causal relationship where the outcome of the test informs our understanding of how similar criteria might be elicited.

Predicate-test.label: test
Predicate-test.description: To evaluate or assess something's quality, accuracy, or validity by comparing it with a standard or expected outcome.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is related to or encompasses the object in some sense. The relationship between the subject and object is one of scope, where the subject represents a specific instance or example of something more general, which is represented by the object.
